articles.title: Vitamin D Status a Common Health Concern for People with Lupus, Though Not Linked to Disease Activity - Lupus Foundation of America
articles.description: Research shows that while taking vitamin D supplements can be a great way to increase blood levels of vitamin D, it may not improve lupus disease activity.
articles.content: Nicknamed the sunshine vitamin, vitamin D can be made by the body when skin is exposed to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun. However, many people with lupus need to avoid the sun due to photose… [+1583 chars]

articles.title: Leaders' summit: Experts call for North American vision - CTV News
articles.description: Trade experts and business leaders hope the continent's leaders have a unified vision for North America as the so-called "Three Amigos" gather this week in Mexico City.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON - 
From the frosty throes of a Canadian winter, the land of conquistadors and Frida Kahlo can seem a million miles away.

articles.title: Three Amigos summit set to start against backdrop of political crises in Mexico - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: This week’s North American Leaders’ Summit is taking place amid mounting accusations of autocracy against the Mexican President
